channel.title: 2 Questions on sounds
channel.description:
TWO QUESTIONS ON SOUNDS:
1. How i can make the server play a sound, when doing something, what is in my client music folder?? - or do i have to code it client side?
2. How i make the music interface play musics which are in my client?

item.title: 2 Questions on sounds
item.dc:creator: @mige5 mige5
item.description:
@mige5 wrote:

i have one too, but the thing is how u make it server side, like if u add new magic sound to client, how u make it play server side and if u have added new area music to client how u make that server side???

Read full topic

item.title: 2 Questions on sounds
item.dc:creator: @mige5 mige5
item.description:
@mige5 wrote:

well, thanks for trying to help, but i already have that, but i was asking how to play sound effects & music which you have added to client… and i dont mean the way it is used to do (music: play-stop-next-previous) in gui

i mean like adding custom sound effects or playing the music when in specific area…

Read full topic

item.title: 2 Questions on sounds
item.dc:creator: @Dart_Zamaki Dart Zamaki
item.description:
@Dart_Zamaki wrote:

Mainly, 317’s have sounds, and 377’s have music (AS WHAT I REMEMBER, THAT MAY HAVE CHANGED! SO DON’T HOLD THAT AGAINST ME ANYONE!)
But yea…
↑↑↑↑↑↑↑↑↑↑↑↑↑↑↑↑↑↑↑↑↑↑↑↑↑↑↑↑↑↑↑↑↑↑↑↑↑↑↑↑↑↑↑↑↑↑↑↑↑↑↑↑↑↑↑↑↑↑↑↑↑↑↑↑↑↑↑↑↑↑↑↑↑↑↑↑↑↑↑↑↑↑↑↑↑↑↑↑↑↑

↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓↓

  1. Here is a code that will play sounds. (depending on the client, sounds will work, if it dosen’t, its client side, not server side.)

Add this to your client.

    public void play_sound(int sound_id, int loops) { // Sound method
        outStream.createFrame(174);
        outStream.writeWord(sound_id);
        outStream.writeByte(loops);
        outStream.writeWord(1);
        updateRequired = true;
        appearanceUpdateRequired = true;
    }

Here is a list that you can use for “sound_id”

1 - small rat getting hit
2 - small rat getting hit?
3 - cow Dieing
4 - cow getting hit
5 - cow attacking
6 - some sqeeky npc getting attacked
7 - some sqeeky npc getting killed
8 - some sqeeky npc attacking
9 - Imp dieing
10 - imp attacking
11 - imp being hit
12 - Bear/something attacking
13 - bear/something Dieing
14 - bear/something being hit
15 - Big rat dieing
16 - big rat being hit
17 - big rat attacking
18 - bear being hit
19 - bear dieing
20 - bear attacking
21 - bird dieing?
22 - bird being hit
23 - bird attacking
24 - chicken being hit
25 - chicken dieing
26 - chicken attacking
27 - cow moooooing
28 - not 100% sure
29 - not 100% sure
30 - not 100% sure
31 - not 100% sure
32 - not 100% sure
33 - not 100% sure
34 - wolf being attacked
35 - wolf dieing
36 - wolf attacking

Hope this helps.
And as by what I know of, it should work.

just use “play_sound(sound,loops);” by what you wish.

  1. Idk about music much. (havn’t expiermented yet with that) Sorry…

Read full topic
